*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Saucedo, August 11, 1826. Forwarding with mild indorsement B. J. Thompson's request for permission to form a company of volunteers. */p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*I inclose to your *person_mentioned*Lordship */person_mentioned*the original and translation of an application of *person_mentioned*Burrel J. Thompson*/person_mentioned* of the *location_mentioned*District of Nacogdoches*/location_mentioned*, for authority to raise a *person_mentioned*company of mounted volunteers */person_mentioned*to assist in defending this *location_mentioned*frontier*/location_mentioned*, and two other papers on the same subject, which he sent to me to be translated. These *person_mentioned*volunteers */person_mentioned*have offered me their services, through *person_mentioned*Thompson*/person_mentioned*, to fight our *person_mentioned*Indian enemies*/person_mentioned*. I have informed them that I was not authorized to accept their offer, unless it is made through the *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*of their *location_mentioned*District*/location_mentioned*, or with your *person_mentioned*Lordship's*/person_mentioned* previous sanction.*/p*
*p*I am fully aware that there are many cavilling *person_mentioned*men*/person_mentioned*, disposed to complain of the *person_mentioned*authorities */person_mentioned*without cause, and, even, to interfere with them. As I am not acquainted with all the reasons that induced the *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*to prohibit the organization of that *person_mentioned*company*/person_mentioned*, I cannot give a decisive opinion on the subject; but from what I could learn of the character and intentions of these *person_mentioned*men*/person_mentioned*, I see no impropriety in allowing them to form a *person_mentioned*company*/person_mentioned*, and I have no doubt that it would be advisable to accept their services to fill the place of the sixty *person_mentioned*men*/person_mentioned* whom the *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*has [been] ordered to furnish me with in an emergency. But your *person_mentioned*Lordship */person_mentioned*will be better able to judge. I have submitted this subject to your *person_mentioned*Lordship */person_mentioned*at the request of the *person_mentioned*parties*/person_mentioned* interested, on account of their ignorance of the Spanish language, and not with an intention to interfere with the business of the *location_mentioned*District of Nacogdoches*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I have also received from the *person_mentioned*people of the *location_mentioned*Trinity*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* a verbal tender of their services against the *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*should they be required; I answered them that I had no authority to accept them without your *person_mentioned*Lordship*/person_mentioned*'s consent.*/p*
*p*There is no doubt when the cold season sets in that the *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*will attack us, and I consider it important to be ready for them in time.*/p*
*p*God and Liberty*/p*.
*p**person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned*. */p* *p**location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="08-11-1826">August 11th 1826*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
